page.title: 06ANIMAL FARMING IN SAMPFORD
page.content: Most of the farms are arable. However, a few keep livestock. This varies with the farmers choice. In our area we can find pigs are intently farmed. Many pigs are kept together in each house. The breeding sows have their piglets which are kept for 14 weeks and fattened for market. Bullocks are male beef cows which are allowed to graze in fields on grass. In Winter they are fed on lessor quality cereal crops. These are kept for two years and sold for beef. Sheep are left to graze in paddocks with extra food when the grass is poor. Ewes produce lambs which are fattened and sent to market. We have many families in our area who own small amounts of land. These people are called smallholders. They keep livestock. This is mostly used to supply food for themselves.
